content:
âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: The game is entertaining!
I love that this game is easy to learn and hard to master. 
If someone is unfamiliar with specific algorithms, he can create greedy algorithms and still have fun. 

And the last league creates so many possible strategies :D

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I played the four leagues. I like this game because
- easy to begin
- probably difficult to be great
- i like the gargoyle

I do not know enough about how these games are made on codingame. Is it possible to add additional leagues after launch? I think this game should have more than one league for the final rule set. There will be a big skill gap.

Thank you for the fun game.

New Rule
* Please change "from the distance" to "from a distance".

Rules - Game Area
* Please change "coordinate" to "coordinates".

Rules - Gargoyle
* Please add "is" after "one turn".

Rules - Presents
* Please change "increase the speed" to "increases the speed".

* Please change "The gargoyle" to "A gargoyle".

Rules - Fireballs
* Please change "from the distance" to "from a distance".

Initialization Input
* Please change "Linia" to "Line".

Input for One Game Turn
* Please change "availabe" to "available" (twice).

Stub
* Is it possible to set different comments in the default codes for different leagues? The description of cooldown contains a spoiler that fireballs will be available, and the output section also shows "FIREBALL id [message]" as a possible output. But fireballs won't be available until later leagues.

Thanks.

âœ… Approved the contribution.
Comment: I had fun. Thank you Santa.
English version available.

Nice!  Please post the Translation.  It isn't as simple as it appears at first.  Hope to see this as a multi.  My current bot is just greedy and uses something like PID.  It is pretty dumb.  I tried out both League 1 and 2.  Haven't tried fireballs yet.

Sorry for the statement in Polish, but the game was prepared for the Santa's Day event for our high schoolers. I will add English statement as the main ones later.

Game is simple, just google-translate rules and you will be ok if you're interested.
I watched it ðŸ˜Š
You are an evil person :P

Again, you are wonderful thank you.
The translation was done in a hurry, so lot of stuff inside, sorry.

I've checked official games and didn't see different stubs, other than plain text note such as:
`in the first league: BREW <id> | WAIT; later: BREW <id> | CAST <id> [<times>] | LEARN <id> | REST | WAIT`

Anyway, for most players what matters is getting to the final league fast, rather than steb by step anticipation, so "spoiler" is somewhat an overstatement. 
I mean yeas I would prefer if this would be possible, but as it is now, I suppose ist OK.

There is half-develped league where the Santas randomly drop bombs.
When getting to close to a bomb you cannot gather presents for a certain number of turns.
Shooting bomb means inst-explosion in larger radius.

Also, initially shooting fireballs gave negative points not positive (so denial-purpose only)
i hope you get a third approval soon. i wish to play.
do you plan to add the santa bomb league? and i do not see your bot on the leaderboard!

No I don't.
I have no bot for this game ^^' (other than debug/testing one ;p)

Thank you!

There's still one more "availabe" that should be changed to "available" in Input section.

I agree the stub mentioning the fireball spell isn't much of a spoiler - it's more of an inconsistency.

I wonder if putting different versions of "stub.txt" in the folders of different levels will do the trick. ðŸ¤”

If not, may I suggest to add a comment in the stub to say "Fireball spells are available from Level 3"?

Thanks again.

I was pretty sure I was fixing this "available" - anyway - now it is fixed.
In stub I put "From League 3: FIREBALL id [message]".
Is that OK with you?
OK ðŸ™‚

May I have your source code to try, for my curiosity, whether putting different versions of "stub.txt" in the folders of different levels works as expected?

Or, alternatively, if you could help by testing it yourself, that would be even better.

Thanks.

I made a game donloadable.

I'm too lazy for that and I assume official CG would do that if possible.
Thanks! I've downloaded the file, and if you want to make it un-downloadable, you may so do now.
FYI, I've tested it, and putting different versions of "stub.txt" in the folders of different levels does work.

Ah, ok.
But note it still does not make much sense as 99.88% you go with your old code through all leagues.
The only case when it makes sense is when you switch your language in "some league"

Indeed. The best way is to use a single stub which mentions which features are not available until later leagues.

In addition to the language swichers, it makes sense for the 0.12% who decide to reset the code in later leagues. ðŸ˜†
